provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from making any false or misleading representations in connection with the advertising, promotion, or sale of goods or services, including specific misrepresentations about credit card affiliation, guaranteed credit, and discounted products.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unauthorized Billing
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from causing a consumer's credit or debit card to be charged or bank account to be debited without express authorization, before receipt of product information, before expiration of any free trial, after a cancellation request, or after the consumer is denied the ability to cancel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance with the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained and enjoined from violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, including by inducing consumers to divulge personal financial information through misrepresentations about bank or credit card affiliation or possession of account information.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance with the Telemarketing Sales Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are restrained and enjoined from violating the Telemarketing Sales Rule, including prohibitions against false statements to induce payment, advance fee collection for credit cards, misrepresentation of refund and cancellation policies, and failure to disclose the purpose of calls.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress Payment
provisions.summary: Defendants are jointly and severally liable for $512,000 in redress, satisfied by a $294,000 payment already deposited with the Commission and a $218,000 receivable assigned to the Commission; individual defendants must also provide taxpayer identifying numbers and driver's license copies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Commission's Use of Funds
provisions.summary: Funds paid to the Commission may be deposited into a fund for equitable relief including consumer redress; any remaining funds may be used for other equitable relief reasonably related to Defendants' practices or deposited to the U.S. Treasury as disgorgement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of the Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The freeze of Defendants' assets pursuant to the Preliminary Injunction Order entered February 4, 2003 shall be lifted to the extent necessary to turn over assets required by Paragraph V, and upon completion of that transfer shall be permanently vacated and lifted.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a truthful sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of this Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendant
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Defendants must deliver copies of this Order and a summary of its injunctive provisions to all principals, officers, employees, agents, and independent contractors, and secure signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days from current personnel and before new personnel begin duties.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Individual Defendants must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment status, and name within 10 days; all Defendants must notify of structural changes to business entities at least 30 days prior; and all Defendants must file annual written compliance reports for five years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Monitoring Compliance of Sales Personnel
provisions.summary: In connection with any business Defendants manage, control, or have a majority ownership interest in, Defendants are restrained from failing to take reasonable steps to monitor and ensure employee and contractor compliance with the Order, including random blind testing, complaint procedures, and corrective action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Record-Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry, Defendants are restrained from failing to create and retain specified business records, including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, sales scripts and marketing materials, and all documents necessary to demonstrate full compliance with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Access to Business Premises
provisions.summary: For five years from entry, Defendants must permit Commission representatives to access any office or facility storing business documents within three business days of written notice, and must allow inspection, copying, and temporary removal of documents for up to three business days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Commission's Authority to Monitor Compliance
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor compliance through multiple means, including requiring Defendants to submit additional written reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, conduct discovery, and pose as consumers or suppliers; Defendants must permit interviews of personnel.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibitions Involving Consumer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or disclosing any consumer identifying information obtained prior to entry of this Order in connection with goods or services marketed by Defendant Assail, Inc., except as required by law or to law enforcement.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party to this Order agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Complete Settlement
provisions.summary: The parties consent to entry of this Order as a final judgment and order constituting a full, complete, and final settlement of this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45; Sections 13(b) and 19 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 6101 et seq.; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Prohibition on Collection of Advance Fees
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from charging or receiving money for any Credit Repair Service before that service is fully performed.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Sale of Tradelines
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from selling or assisting in selling any Credit Repair Service that adds a person as an authorized user to another person's credit account unless that person is given access to such credit.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibitions on Marketing of Credit Repair Services
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from making various misrepresentations in the marketing of Credit Repair Services and from violating CROA disclosure requirements.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Deceptive Business Activities Regarding Any Products or Services
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting the legality, refund policies, or material facts of any product or service, and must clearly disclose refund and cancellation terms.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unsubstantiated Claims
provisions.summary: Defendants must not make any representation about the benefits, performance, or efficacy of any product or service unless they possess and rely upon competent and reliable evidence sufficient to substantiate that the representation is true.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Injunction Relating to Telemarketing
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting material aspects of goods or services during telemarketing and from violating the FTC's Telemarketing Sales Rule.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment
provisions.summary: A judgment of $6,630,678 is entered against Defendants jointly and severally; Defendants must pay $64,863 within 7 days of entry, after which the remainder is suspended subject to conditions including accuracy of financial representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must provide customer information to the FTC for redress administration upon request, are prohibited from using or disclosing previously obtained customer information, and must destroy such information within 30 days of FTC direction or one year after entry of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Each Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies to current and future relevant personnel, and obtain signed acknowledgments within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit a sworn compliance report one year after entry of the Order, and for 20 years must submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any material changes; all submissions must be sworn under penalty of perjury and submitted to the FTC by prescribed means.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create certain records for 20 years after entry of the Order and retain each such record for 5 years, including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC is authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through document requests, depositions, discovery, direct communication with employees, and consumer reporting agency inquiries; Defendants must cooperate within 14 days of written requests.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 410(b) of the Credit Repair Organizations Act (CROA), 15 U.S.C. § 1679h(b); Section 6(b) of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105(b)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Disclosure of Pre-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose to any third party for marketing purposes any personally identifiable information collected from consumers prior to the date of service of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Conditional Prohibition on Disclosure of Post-Order Consumer Information for Marketing
provisions.summary: Respondent must not sell, rent, or disclose post-Order consumer information for marketing purposes unless it first provided the merchant customer a clear written notice and obtained written certification, or provided a clear disclosure directly to consumers about Respondent's data practices.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Disgorgement Payment
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $9,101.63 to the United States Treasury as disgorgement within five days of service of this Order, with interest accruing on any default balance.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Delivery
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the Order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities, and obtain signed, dated acknowledgments of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this Order, including dissolution, sale, merger, bankruptcy filings, or name/address changes.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within sixty days of service of this Order, and at such other times as the FTC may require.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The Order terminates on April 19, 2025, or twenty years from the most recent date a complaint alleging an Order violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

provisions.title: Permanent Ban on Outbound Telemarketing
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently enjoined from initiating, assisting, or causing outbound telemarketing calls, and from owning or controlling any company that does so, with a narrow exception for manually dialed calls to persons with an established business relationship or express written agreement.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Violating the Fair Credit Reporting Act
provisions.summary: Defendant and those acting in concert with him are permanently enjoined from using or obtaining consumer reports without a valid permissible purpose and from violating any provision of the FCRA.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations
provisions.summary: Defendant and those acting in concert with him are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting their affiliation with competitor alarm companies, their acquisition of competitor businesses, or the name of Defendant's business.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Monetary Judgment for Civil Penalty and Suspension
provisions.summary: A civil penalty judgment of $9,845,021 is entered against Defendant, with $88,000 payable in two installments and personal jewelry liquidated; the remainder of the judgment is suspended conditioned on the truthfulness of Defendant's sworn financial representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all interest in transferred assets, consents to facts in the Complaint being taken as true in future proceedings, and acknowledges the civil penalty is not dischargeable in bankruptcy.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with the FTC in this case and related investigations, provide truthful testimony and documents on five days' written notice, and consent to disclosure of electronic communications records for compliance monitoring purposes.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within seven days, deliver copies to all relevant business personnel and contractors within seven days (or before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within thirty days.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must file a sworn annual compliance report one year after entry of the Order detailing contact information, business activities, and compliance status, and must file sworn notices within fourteen days of any changes to name, contact information, or business structure for twenty years, as well as notice of any bankruptcy filing.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create specified business records for twenty years and retain each record for five years, covering accounting, personnel, consumer complaints, established business relationships, express written agreements, and all compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The FTC has broad rights to monitor Defendant's compliance, including requesting additional reports and depositions within fourteen days, communicating directly with Defendant, interviewing affiliated employees, and using undercover methods, as well as employing all lawful compulsory process.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction of this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of this Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Sections 5(a), 5(m)(1)(A), 13(b), and 16(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 45(a), 45(m)(1)(A), 53(b), and 56(a); Section 6 of the Telemarketing and Consumer Fraud and Abuse Prevention Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6105; and Section 621(a) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. § 1681s(a)

provisions.title: Prohibition on Use or Disclosure of Covered Information for Defined Advertising Purposes
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from using or disclosing Covered Information for advertising or marketing purposes (Defined Advertising Purposes) or for any third party's purposes, with a narrow exception for Limited Visitor Data used for analytics and reporting.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Affirmative Express Consent
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from disclosing any consumer's Covered Information to any Outside Party without first obtaining that consumer's Affirmative Express Consent.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations Related to Negative Options
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from misrepresenting any material aspect of its Negative Option Feature offers, including cancellation terms, costs, free-trial claims, billing authorization, and refund or cancellation policies.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation with Assessor
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide Assessors with all relevant information and materials and must not misrepresent any material facts to the Assessor in connection with any mandated Assessment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Defendant must annually provide the FTC with a certification from a senior corporate manager confirming that the Program has been established and maintained, that there is no uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing any Covered Incidents during the period.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Defendant must report each Covered Incident to the Assessor and FTC within 30 days of discovery, with updates every 30 days until fully resolved, and publish a public version of the report on its websites and apps within 45 days of verification.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Notice to Users
provisions.summary: Within 14 days of the Order, Defendant must post a prescribed Notice on its websites and apps and email it to all consumers who provided Covered Information between October 2019 and March 1, 2023, keeping the Notice in place for two years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Data Retention Limits and Deletion of Covered Information and Data Product
provisions.summary: Defendant must document a retention schedule within 7 days, delete all Covered Information not used for Treatment, Payment, or Health Care Operations within 60 days, provide a consumer deletion request mechanism within 60 days, identify all third-party recipients within 30 days, and instruct those third parties to delete Covered Information within 60 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Required Disclosures Relating to Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant is permanently prohibited from promoting any Negative Option Feature without making specific Clear and Conspicuous disclosures about costs, affirmative action required to avoid charges, recurring charge deadlines, and cancellation mechanisms; and must send written transaction confirmations to consumers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Obtaining Express Informed Consent for a Negative Option
provisions.summary: Defendant must obtain the consumer's express informed consent before using Billing Information for a Negative Option Feature, through a standalone affirmative checkbox or signature for written offers, or oral confirmation for telephone offers, with voice recordings retained for 3 years for telemarketing transactions.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Simple Mechanism to Cancel Negative Option Feature
provisions.summary: Defendant must provide consumers with a simple, easy-to-find, and easy-to-use cancellation mechanism that does not require unnecessary steps or use Dark Patterns, available through the same channel (Internet, phone, or mail) through which the consumer enrolled.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Monetary Judgments for Monetary Relief and Civil Penalty
provisions.summary: Defendant is ordered to pay $5,087,252.89 as monetary relief and $10,000,000 as a civil penalty, with $2,000,000 of the civil penalty paid immediately (the remainder suspended based on Defendant's financial representations) and the monetary relief paid within 7 days of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Defendant relinquishes all rights to transferred assets, the Complaint's facts may be taken as true in future proceedings, and monetary relief funds may be used for consumer redress or, if impracticable, for related relief or deposited into the U.S. Treasury as an additional civil penalty.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Independent Redress Administrator
provisions.summary: If the FTC determines redress is practicable, an independent redress administrator will be appointed; Defendant must provide Eligible Customer information within 7 days of notification, cooperate fully with the Administrator, and pay all Administrator costs and fees.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn acknowledgment of receipt of the Order within 7 days, deliver copies of the Order to all relevant personnel and businesses within 7 days (or before they assume responsibilities), and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendant must submit a sworn compliance report one year after the Order's entry and submit sworn compliance notices within 14 days of any change in points of contact or corporate structure for 20 years; all submissions must be made to the FTC via email or overnight courier.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendant must create and retain for 5 years (over a 20-year period) accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaint records, all compliance records, and copies of all marketing materials related to health services and Negative Option Feature products.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendant's compliance through compliance reports, depositions, document production, and direct communications with Defendant and its employees; Defendant must comply with written requests within 14 days.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Cooperation
provisions.summary: Defendant must fully cooperate with Plaintiff and the Commission in this case and any related investigation, providing truthful and complete information and causing its personnel to appear for proceedings upon 5 days' written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 5(m)(1)(A) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(m)(1)(A); Section 13(b) of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. § 53(b); Section 8023 of the Opioid Addiction Recovery Fraud Prevention Act of 2018, 15 U.S.C. § 45d; Section 5 of the Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act (ROSCA), 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Ban on Future Telemarketing Activities
provisions.summary: All Defendants are permanently restrained and enjoined from engaging or participating in telemarketing of any credit-related products, programs, or services, directly or through any intermediary.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Injunction Against False or Misleading Statements
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from making any false or misleading representations in connection with advertising, promoting, or selling any credit-related products or services.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violating the Telemarketing Sales Rule
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from violating or assisting any person in violating any provision of the Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Injunction Against Violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from violating or assisting any person in violating Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, including inducing consumers to divulge personal financial information through false representations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress and Other Equitable Relief from the Canadian Defendants
provisions.summary: Judgment of $9,066,434 is entered jointly and severally against the Canadian Defendants; they must pay $405,589.50 to the Commission within five business days of entry of the Order, with the remainder suspended upon timely payment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Enforce Suspended Judgment Against the Canadian Defendants
provisions.summary: The Commission's agreement to suspend judgment is premised on the accuracy of the Canadian Defendants' sworn financial statements; if misrepresentation is found, the full $9,066,434 judgment becomes immediately due.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Redress and Other Equitable Relief from the Florida Defendants
provisions.summary: Judgment of $9,066,434 is entered jointly and severally against the Florida Defendants; they must pay $9,600 to the Commission within five business days of entry of the Order, with the remainder suspended upon timely payment.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Right to Enforce Suspended Judgment Against the Florida Defendants
provisions.summary: The Commission's agreement to suspend judgment is premised on the accuracy of the Florida Defendants' sworn financial statements; if misrepresentation is found, the full $9,066,434 judgment becomes immediately due.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Lifting of Asset Freeze
provisions.summary: The asset freeze against all Defendants is lifted solely for the purpose of transferring funds to the FTC pursuant to the judgment paragraphs, and is dissolved upon transfer of all such funds.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Transfer of Customer Lists
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from selling, renting, leasing, transferring, or disclosing identifying information of any person who paid money to any Defendant for any credit-related product, program, or service.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Acknowledgment of Receipt of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: All Defendants must submit a sworn statement to the Commission acknowledging receipt of the Order within five business days of receipt.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Distribution of Order by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, all Defendants must distribute copies of the Order to principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives, and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt within 30 days of delivery.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting by Defendants
provisions.summary: For five years from entry of the Order, Defendants must notify the Commission of changes in residence, employment, and corporate structure, and must file a sworn written compliance report 180 days after entry.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Record Keeping Provisions
provisions.summary: For eight years from entry of the Order, all Defendants must create and retain specified business records including accounting records, personnel records, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, and compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Authority to Monitor Compliance
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor compliance by all lawful means; Defendants must submit additional reports, produce documents, appear for deposition, and provide access to business locations within ten days of written notice.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Fees and Costs
provisions.summary: Each party to this Order agrees to bear its own costs and attorneys' fees incurred in connection with this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction and Entry of Judgment
provisions.summary: This Court retains jurisdiction of this matter to apply for further orders and directives, to enforce compliance, or to punish violations.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Complete Settlement
provisions.summary: The FTC and Defendants consent to entry of the foregoing Order as a final judgment and full, complete, and final settlement of this action.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Sections 13(b) and 19 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 53(b) and 57(b); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Section 521 of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. § 6821

provisions.title: Disgorgement Payment to U.S. Treasury
provisions.summary: Respondent must pay $4,608 to the United States Treasury as disgorgement within five days of service of this Order, by cashier's or certified check, with interest accruing on any unpaid balance after a ten-day default period.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Acknowledgment and Delivery of Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with relevant responsibilities — current personnel within 30 days of service, future personnel within 30 days of assuming their role.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the FTC at least 30 days prior to any corporate change that may affect compliance obligations under this Order, such as dissolution, merger, sale, bankruptcy filing, or name/address change, by certified mail to the FTC's Division of Enforcement.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a written compliance report with the FTC within 60 days of service of this Order, and at such other times as the FTC may require, detailing the manner and form in which it has complied with the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: This Order terminates on September 10, 2024, or twenty years from the most recent date the FTC files a complaint alleging any violation of the Order in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.
provisions.legal_authority: Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45 et seq

provisions.title: Prohibited Business Activities (Fair Credit Reporting Act)
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently restrained from failing to maintain FCRA-required procedures and from furnishing consumer reports to persons without a permissible purpose.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Fair Credit Reporting Act Monitoring Program
provisions.summary: Each Covered Business must establish, implement, and maintain a comprehensive monitoring program to regularly assess FCRA applicability and compliance before advertising or offering Covered Information for sale.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations to Consumers
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from misrepresenting, expressly or by implication, what users can achieve with the service, payment or cancellation terms, company policies, the likelihood a consumer has Covered Records, or any other material fact regarding Covered Records.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Unsubstantiated Representations Regarding Covered Records
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from stating that a consumer may have, does have, or that there are possible Covered Records, unless the representation is non-misleading and Defendants have actually found a Covered Record about that consumer from a third-party source.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Statements Regarding Traffic Tickets
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from stating, directly or by implication, that a traffic ticket or traffic citation is a criminal or arrest record.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Ban on Negative Options
provisions.summary: Defendants are permanently enjoined from advertising, marketing, promoting, or offering for sale any product or service with a Negative Option Feature.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Monetary Judgments and Partial Suspensions
provisions.summary: Establishes monetary judgments against Corporate Defendant ($28,945,968) and Individual Defendant ($5,000,000), with payment schedules totaling $16,000,000 and $5,000,000 respectively, secured by a deed of trust on Individual Defendant's property; specifies conditions for suspension, reinstatement, and default.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Additional Monetary Provisions
provisions.summary: Establishes ancillary monetary terms including relinquishment of asset claims, use of complaint facts in future proceedings, nondischargeability provisions, taxpayer ID submission, use of collected funds for consumer redress, and obligation to provide customer information for redress administration.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Customer Information
provisions.summary: Defendants must provide specified MyLife customer information to the Commission within 14 days and are permanently enjoined from disclosing or benefitting from customer information obtained prior to the Order, except for current customers if Defendants comply with Sections I–VI.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgments
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit sworn acknowledgments of receipt of the Order and deliver copies to principals, employees, agents, and third-party data providers, obtaining signed acknowledgments from each recipient.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Defendants must submit annual compliance reports to the Commission sworn under penalty of perjury, report material changes within 14 days, report bankruptcy filings within 14 days, and annually submit FCRA monitoring program documentation for 20 years.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Defendants must create and retain specified records for 20 years after entry of the Order, retaining each record for five years, covering accounting, personnel, customer files, complaints, marketing materials, training materials, and compliance documentation.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Annual Certifications
provisions.summary: Starting one year after issuance, Individual Defendant and Corporate Defendant must each annually certify to the Commission that Order requirements have been established, implemented, and maintained, and that no uncorrected or undisclosed material noncompliance exists.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission and Plaintiff are authorized to monitor Defendants' compliance through written requests for reports, depositions, document production, direct communications with Defendants' personnel, and undercover methods including posing as consumers or suppliers.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404

provisions.title: Retention of Jurisdiction
provisions.summary: The Court retains jurisdiction over this matter for purposes of construction, modification, and enforcement of the Order.
provisions.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a); Section 16(a)(1) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 56(a)(1); Telemarketing Sales Rule, 16 C.F.R. Part 310; Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 1681-1681x; Restore Online Shoppers' Confidence Act, 15 U.S.C. § 8404
